goal: Ensure every 'use' action advances simulation time and drains appropriate energy.
decisions: Treat one action tick as roughly 10 minutes; successful use interactions should return ActionSuccess with a time_cost of at least 1.
Use the blueprint-defined time_cost for final assembly while keeping per-material contributions lightweight (1 tick).
Add small time and energy costs for fueling fires and consuming items so every successful use path advances time.
plan: Audit try_use branches to convert success results into ActionSuccess with non-zero time_cost values.
Update blueprint completion to consume its configured time_cost when assembling the final item.
Adjust fire fueling and consumption handlers to spend time and energy and route through ActionSuccess.
Run cargo tests/checks and update todo.json status to reflect the completed work.
notes: The universal use command applies time progression via world.tick() for each ActionSuccess time_cost step.
Energy drain is applied by the MCP server after ActionSuccess; keep energy_cost minimal for small tasks.
